00019 #define TEST_READ 1
00020 #define TEST_WRITE 2
00021 #define MDONLY_READ 3

00024 void init_vars(hash_table_t **ht_ip_stats, pool_t **ip_stats_pool)
00025 {
00026   int rc;
00027 
00028   /* Get the FSAL functions */
00029   FSAL_LoadFunctions();
00030 
00031   /* Get the FSAL consts */
00032   FSAL_LoadConsts();
00033 
00034   nfs_set_param_default(&nfs_param);
00035 
00036   /*ht_ip_stats*/
00037   return;
00038   *ht_ip_stats = nfs_Init_ip_stats(nfs_param.ip_stats_param);
00039   /*  if((*ht_ip_stats = HashTable_Init(nfs_param.ip_stats_param.hash_param)) == NULL)
00040     {
00041       LogCrit(COMPONENT_INIT, "NFS IP_STATS: Cannot init IP stats cache");
00042       return NULL;
00043       }*/
00044 
00045   if(*ht_ip_stats == NULL)
00046     {
00047       LogCrit(COMPONENT_INIT, "NFS_INIT: Error while initializing IP/stats cache");
00048       exit(1);
00049     }
00050 
00051   *ip_stats_pool
00052        = pool_init("IP Stats Cache Pool", nfs_ip_stats_t,
00053                    pool_basic_substrate, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00054 
00055   if(!(*ip_stats_pool))
00056     {
00057       LogCrit(COMPONENT_INIT, "NFS_INIT: Error while allocating IP stats cache pool");
00058       LogError(COMPONENT_INIT, ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno);
00059       exit(1);
00060     }
00061 }

00063 int test_access(char *addr, char *hostname,
00064                 hash_table_t *ht_ip_stats,
00065                 pool_t *ip_stats_pool,
00066                 exportlist_t *pexport, int uid, int operation)
00067 {
00068   struct svc_req ptr_req;
00069   exportlist_client_entry_t pclient_found;
00070   struct user_cred user_credentials;
00071   unsigned int nfs_prog;
00072   unsigned int mnt_prog;
00073   sockaddr_t ssaddr;
00074   sockaddr_t *pssaddr = &ssaddr;
00075   int errcode;
00076   int export_check_result;
00077   bool_t proc_makes_write;
00078 
00079   if (operation == TEST_WRITE || operation == MDONLY_WRITE)
00080     proc_makes_write = TRUE;
00081   else
00082     proc_makes_write = FALSE;
00083 
00084   /*pssaddr*/
00085   errcode = ipstring_to_sockaddr(addr, pssaddr);
00086   if (errcode != 0)
00087     {
00088       perror ("getaddrinfo");
00089       return -1;
00090     }
00091 
00092   /* ptr_req */
00093   memset(&ptr_req, 0, sizeof(struct svc_req));
00094   ptr_req.rq_cred.oa_flavor = AUTH_UNIX;
00095   ptr_req.rq_proc = 23232;
00096   /*nfs_prog*/
00097   nfs_prog = nfs_param.core_param.program[P_NFS];
00098 
00099   /*mnt_prog*/
00100   mnt_prog = nfs_param.core_param.program[P_MNT];
00101   if (operation == TEST_MOUNT)
00102     ptr_req.rq_prog = mnt_prog;
00103   else
00104     ptr_req.rq_prog = nfs_prog;
00105 
00106   /*user_credentials*/
00107   user_credentials.caller_uid = uid;
00108 
00109   export_check_result = nfs_export_check_access(pssaddr,
00110                                                 &ptr_req,
00111                                                 pexport,
00112                                                 nfs_prog,
00113                                                 mnt_prog,
00114                                                 ht_ip_stats,
00115                                                 ip_stats_pool,
00116                                                 &pclient_found,
00117                                                 &user_credentials,
00118                                                 proc_makes_write);
00119   return export_check_result;
00120 }
00121 
00122 int expected(int expected_result, int export_check_result) {
00123   if (export_check_result == expected_result)
00124     return 0;
00125   else {
00126       printf("\tFAIL: ");
00127   }
00128   
00129   if (export_check_result == EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED)
00130     {
00131       printf("received EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED, ");
00132     } 
00133   else if (export_check_result == EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_RO)
00134     {
00135       printf("received EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_RO, ");
00136     }
00137   else if (export_check_result == EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_MDONLY_RO)
00138     {
00139       printf("received EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_MDONLY_RO, ");
00140     }
00141   else if (export_check_result == EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED)
00142     {
00143       printf("received EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED, ");
00144     }
00145   else if (export_check_result == EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED)
00146     {
00147       printf("received EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED, ");
00148     }
00149   else
00150     {
00151       printf("Not sure what we received, ");
00152     }
00153 
00154   if (expected_result == EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED)
00155     {
00156       printf("expected EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED\n");
00157     } 
00158   else if (expected_result == EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_RO)
00159     {
00160       printf("expected EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_RO\n");
00161     }
00162   else if (expected_result == EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_MDONLY_RO)
00163     {
00164       printf("expected EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_MDONLY_RO\n");
00165     }
00166   else if (expected_result == EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED)
00167     {
00168       printf("expected EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED\n");
00169     }
00170   else if (expected_result == EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED)
00171     {
00172       printf("expected EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED\n");
00173     }
00174   else
00175     {
00176       printf("Not sure what to expect\n");
00177     }
00178   return 1;
00179 }
00180 
00181 int predict(char *addr, char *hostname, int root, int read, int write,
00182             int md_read, int md_write, int uid, int operation)
00183 
00184 {
00185   /* if uid = 0 then uid will be anonymous and may be declined in the FSAL.
00186    * However we still give permissions to continue executing request. */
00187 
00188   if (operation == TEST_MOUNT)
00189     return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00190 
00191   if (operation == TEST_WRITE || operation == MDONLY_WRITE)
00192     {
00193       if (root && uid == 0)
00194         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00195 
00196       if (write)
00197         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00198 
00199       if (md_write)
00200         return EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED;
00201 
00202       return EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED;
00203     }
00204 
00205   if (operation == TEST_READ || operation == MDONLY_READ)
00206     {
00207       if (root && uid == 0)
00208         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00209 
00210       if (read || write)
00211         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00212 
00213       if (md_read || md_write)
00214         return EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED;
00215       
00216       return EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED;
00217     }  
00218   
00219   /* What else could we default to? */
00220   return -1;
00221 }
00222 
00223 int old_predict(char *ip, char *hostname, int root, int nonroot,
00224                 int accesstype, int uid, int operation)
00225 {
00226   if (operation == TEST_MOUNT)
00227     return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00228 
00229   if (operation == TEST_WRITE)
00230     {
00231       if (((nonroot && uid != 0) || (nonroot && uid == 0) || (root && uid == 0)) &&
00232           accesstype == TEST_WRITE)
00233         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00234 
00235       if (accesstype == MDONLY_READ)
00236         return EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_MDONLY_RO;
00237       if (accesstype == TEST_READ)
00238         return EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_RO;
00239 
00240       return EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED;
00241     }
00242 
00243   if (operation == MDONLY_WRITE)
00244     {
00245       if (((nonroot && uid != 0) || (nonroot && uid == 0) || (root && uid == 0)) &&
00246           accesstype == TEST_WRITE)
00247         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00248 
00249       if (((nonroot && uid != 0) || (nonroot && uid == 0) || (root && uid == 0)) &&
00250           accesstype == MDONLY_WRITE)
00251         return EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED;
00252 
00253       if (accesstype == MDONLY_READ)
00254         return EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_MDONLY_RO;
00255       if (accesstype == TEST_READ)
00256         return EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_RO;
00257 
00258       return EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED;
00259     }
00260 
00261   if (operation == TEST_READ)
00262     {
00263       if (((nonroot && uid != 0) || (nonroot && uid == 0) || (root && uid == 0)) &&
00264           (accesstype == TEST_READ || accesstype == TEST_WRITE))
00265         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00266 
00267       if (((nonroot && uid != 0) || (nonroot && uid == 0) || (root && uid == 0)) &&
00268           (accesstype == MDONLY_READ || accesstype == MDONLY_WRITE))
00269         return EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED;
00270 
00271       return EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED;
00272     }
00273 
00274   if (operation == MDONLY_READ)
00275     {
00276       if (((nonroot && uid != 0) || (nonroot && uid == 0) || (root && uid == 0)) &&
00277           (accesstype == TEST_READ || accesstype == TEST_WRITE))
00278         return EXPORT_PERMISSION_GRANTED;
00279 
00280       if (((nonroot && uid != 0) || (nonroot && uid == 0) || (root && uid == 0)) &&
00281           accesstype == MDONLY_READ)
00282         return EXPORT_MDONLY_GRANTED;
00283 
00284       return EXPORT_PERMISSION_DENIED;      
00285     }
00286   
00287   /* What else could we default to? */
00288   return -1;
00289 }
00290 
00291 #define ROOT_UID 0
00292 #define USER_UID 1000
00293 
00294 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00295 {
00296   hash_table_t *ht_ip_stats;
00297   pool_t *ip_stats_pool;
00298   exportlist_t pexport;
00299   int root, read, write, mdonly_read, mdonly_write,
00300     root_user, uid, operation, export_check_result,
00301     predicted_result, nonroot, accesstype,
00302     return_status=0;
00303   char *ip = "127.0.0.1";
00304   char *match_str = "*";
00305   char *hostname = "localhost";
00306 
00307   /*
00308   int rc;
00309   sockaddr_t pipaddr;
00310   char hostname[MAXHOSTNAMELEN];
00311   rc = ipstring_to_sockaddr(ip, &pipaddr);
00312   if (rc != 0)
00313     {
00314       printf("FAIL: Could not create sockaddr from ip %s\n", ip);
00315       perror ("getaddrinfo");
00316       return 1;
00317     }
00318   rc = getnameinfo((struct sockaddr *)&pipaddr, sizeof(pipaddr),
00319                    hostname, sizeof(hostname),
00320                    NULL, 0, 0);
00321   if(rc != 0)
00322     {
00323        printf("FAIL: Cannot resolve address %s, error %s", ip, gai_strerror(rc));
00324        return 1;
00325     }
00326   */
00327   printf("Using IP=%s and Hostname=%s\n", ip, hostname);
00328 
00329   SetDefaultLogging("TEST");
00330   SetNamePgm("test_mnt_proto");
00331 
00332   init_vars(&ht_ip_stats, &ip_stats_pool);
00333 
00334   printf("TESTING THE NEW ACCESS LIST FORMAT\n------------------------------------\n");
00335   printf("TEST: root read write mdonly_read mdonly_write : uid operation\n");
00336 /* loop through all combinations of new access list uses. */
00337   for(root=0; root < 2; root++)
00338     for(read=0; read < 2; read++)
00339       for(write=0; write < 2; write++)
00340         for(mdonly_read=0; mdonly_read < 2; mdonly_read++)
00341           for(mdonly_write=0; mdonly_write < 2; mdonly_write++)
00342             {
00343               memset(&pexport, 0, sizeof(pexport));
00344 
00345               /* These strings come from local defines in ../support/exports.c */
00346               if (root)
00347                   parseAccessParam("Root_Access", match_str, &pexport, EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT);
00348               if (read)
00349                   parseAccessParam("R_Access", match_str, &pexport, EXPORT_OPTION_READ_ACCESS);
00350               if (write)
00351                   parseAccessParam("RW_Access", match_str, &pexport,
00352                                    EXPORT_OPTION_READ_ACCESS | EXPORT_OPTION_WRITE_ACCESS);
00353               if (mdonly_read)
00354                   parseAccessParam("MDONLY_RO_Access", match_str, &pexport, EXPORT_OPTION_MD_READ_ACCESS);
00355               if (mdonly_write)
00356                 parseAccessParam("MDONLY_Access", match_str, &pexport,
00357                                  EXPORT_OPTION_MD_WRITE_ACCESS | EXPORT_OPTION_MD_READ_ACCESS);
00358 
00359               /* This is critical */
00360               pexport.new_access_list_version = 1;
00361 
00362               /* With this export entry test both root and user access. */
00363               for(root_user=0; root_user < 2; root_user++)
00364                 for(operation=0; operation < 5; operation++)
00365                   {
00366                     if (root_user == 0)
00367                       uid = USER_UID;
00368                     else
00369                       uid = ROOT_UID;
00370                     
00371                     printf("TEST: %d %d %d %d %d : %d ",
00372                            root, read, write, mdonly_read, mdonly_write,uid);
00373                     if (operation == TEST_MOUNT)
00374                       printf("TEST_MOUNT\n");
00375                     else if (operation == TEST_READ)
00376                       printf("READ\n");
00377                     else if (operation == TEST_WRITE)
00378                       printf("WRITE\n");
00379                     else if (operation == MDONLY_READ)
00380                       printf("MDONLY_READ\n");
00381                     else if (operation == MDONLY_WRITE)
00382                       printf("MDONLY_WRITE\n");
00383 
00384                     export_check_result = test_access(ip, hostname, ht_ip_stats, ip_stats_pool,
00385                                                       &pexport, uid, operation);
00386                     
00387                     /* predict how the result will turn out */
00388                     predicted_result = predict(ip, hostname, root, read, write,
00389                                                mdonly_read, mdonly_write, uid, operation);
00390                     
00391                     /* report on what was expected vs what we received */
00392                     if (expected(predicted_result, export_check_result) == 1)
00393                       return_status = 1;
00394                   }
00395             }
00396   
00397   /* loop through all combinations of old access list uses. */
00398   printf("\n\nTESTING THE OLDER ACCESS LIST FORMAT\n------------------------------------\n");
00399   printf("TEST: root nonroot accesstype : uid operation\n");
00400 /* loop through all combinations of new access list uses. */
00401   for(root=0; root < 2; root++)
00402     for(nonroot=0; nonroot < 2; nonroot++)
00403       for(accesstype=1; accesstype < 4; accesstype++)
00404       {
00405         memset(&pexport, 0, sizeof(pexport));
00406 
00407         /* These strings come from local defines in ../support/exports.c */
00408         if (root)
00409           parseAccessParam("Root_Access", match_str, &pexport, EXPORT_OPTION_ROOT);
00410         if (nonroot)
00411           parseAccessParam("Access", match_str, &pexport, EXPORT_OPTION_READ_ACCESS|EXPORT_OPTION_WRITE_ACCESS);
00412 
00413         if (accesstype == TEST_READ)
00414           pexport.access_type = ACCESSTYPE_RO;
00415         else if (accesstype == TEST_WRITE)
00416           pexport.access_type = ACCESSTYPE_RW;
00417         else if (accesstype == MDONLY_READ)
00418           pexport.access_type = ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY_RO;
00419         else if (accesstype == MDONLY_WRITE)
00420           pexport.access_type = ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY;
00421         else
00422           printf("FAIL: INVALID access_type \n");
00423 
00424         /* This is critical */
00425         pexport.new_access_list_version = 0;
00426         
00427         /* With this export entry test both root and user access. */
00428         for(root_user=0; root_user < 2; root_user++)
00429           for(operation=0; operation < 5; operation++)
00430             {
00431               if (root_user == 0)
00432                 uid = USER_UID;
00433               else
00434                 uid = ROOT_UID;
00435               
00436               printf("TEST: %d %d ", root, nonroot);
00437               if (accesstype == TEST_READ)
00438                 printf("ACCESSTYPE_RO ");
00439               else if (accesstype == TEST_WRITE)
00440                 printf("ACCESSTYPE_RW ");
00441               else if (accesstype == MDONLY_READ)
00442                 printf("ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY_RO ");
00443               else if (accesstype == MDONLY_WRITE)
00444                 printf("ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY ");
00445               else
00446                 printf("INVALID ");
00447               printf(": %d ",uid);
00448               if (operation == TEST_MOUNT)
00449                 printf("TEST_MOUNT\n");
00450               else if (operation == TEST_READ)
00451                 printf("READ\n");
00452               else if (operation == TEST_WRITE)
00453                 printf("WRITE\n");
00454               else if (operation == MDONLY_READ)
00455                 printf("MDONLY_READ\n");
00456               else if (operation == MDONLY_WRITE)
00457                 printf("MDONLY_WRITE\n");
00458               
00459               export_check_result = test_access(ip, hostname, ht_ip_stats, ip_stats_pool,
00460                                                 &pexport, uid, operation);
00461               
00462               /* predict how the result will turn out */
00463               if ((operation == TEST_WRITE || operation == MDONLY_WRITE) && accesstype == TEST_READ)
00464                 predicted_result = EXPORT_WRITE_ATTEMPT_WHEN_RO;
00465               else
00466                 predicted_result = old_predict(ip, hostname, root, nonroot,
00467                                                accesstype, uid, operation);
00468               
00469               /* report on what was expected vs what we received */
00470               if (expected(predicted_result, export_check_result) == 1)
00471                 return_status = 1;
00472             }
00473       }
00474 
00475   printf("----------------------------------------------------\n");
00476   if (!return_status)
00477     printf("ALL ACCESS LIST TYPE TESTS COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!!\n");
00478   else
00479     printf("ACCESS LIST TYPE TESTS FAILED!!\n");
00480   printf("----------------------------------------------------\n");
00481 
00482   return return_status;
00483 }
